articles.contents:
Contents
Set Up
Hackathons
Part I - Creating a Data Story (November 16th, 2022)
Part II - Group Feedback (November 22th, 2022)
Part III - Group Feedback and Reflection (December 6th, 2022)


Set Up
The Center for Cognitive and Decision Sciences (CDS) coordinates collaborative projects involving CDS members and MSc students associated with the center as part of its mission to provide training in data analytics (see cds.unibas.ch for more information).
The project will consist of a series of planning sessions and multiple collaborative hackathons. Resources related to the hackathons will be available our Github repository.
Hackathons
Part I - Creating a Data Story (November 16th, 2022)
Part II - Group Feedback (November 22th, 2022)
Part III - Group Feedback and Reflection (December 6th, 2022)

articles.title: CDS Risk Hackathon
articles.description:
Visualizing semantic accounts of risk perception

Last update: `r format(Sys.time(), "%b %d, %Y")`
articles.contents:
This is the home of the CDS Risk Hackathon taking place Fall 2022 (HS22).
The project consists of a hackathon that utilizes data from the scientific outputs of Unibas researchers. More information about the hackathon and the associated data will be updated in the respective pages. The results of the hackathon will be made available in the report.
Interested? Send us an email at cds-psych@unibas.ch!
CDS Hackthon

articles.title: R Training
articles.description:
Preparing for the hackathon

Addiitonal details to be added soon!
articles.contents:
Contents
R Training Workshop

R Training Workshop
This year, CDS will be offering a R training workshop for students attending the hackathon. Any BSc or MSc students at the Faculty of Psychology planning to join the hackathon are very welcome to this training session! Further details will soon be added on this page. Please indicate your interest by writing to cds-psych@unibas.ch.
Together, we will look at some of the functions and plots that will be most useful for the hackathon.
If you are new to R or need a refresher, we recommend you to go through the topics in R Training Website for CDS MSc Students, where we have compiled different online materials on basic R skills.

Topics 2 and 7-10 will especially come in handy!
